item.title: Jamf Pro Partial Outage
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Outage: Communication Issue with APNS

Some Jamf Pro customers are experiencing issues related to communication with APNS, causing major disruptions. We are working to resolve the issue and will provide a further update in 45 minutes.

Mar 12, 17:04 UTC
Investigating - An issue has been identified that is affecting some Jamf Pro customers. We are working to resolve and will provide next update in 45 minutes. Currently this seems to be related to communication with APNS.

Jamf Cloud will undergo upgrades on March 9th from 07:00 to 21:00 UTC. More information available on the Jamf Nation and Jamf Pro release notes websites. Summary: Scheduled upgrades for Jamf Cloud on March 9th.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 9, 07:00 - 21:00 UTC

item.title: Jamf School: APNs issues
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Investigating Issue Summary: The company is currently investigating an issue affecting the downloading of CSR tokens and installing AppStore apps. [High] - Continuing Investigation of Workflow Issue Summary: The company is continuing to investigate the issue affecting the downloading of CSR tokens and installing AppStore apps.

Mar 4, 08:41 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue.

Following workflows have been impacted:
- downloading CSR token used for generating new and renewing APNs certificate
- Installing AppStore Apps

Mar 4, 08:22 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Jamf ID Upgrade
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Jamf ID Security Enhancements and User Sign-ups Disabled

On March 1-2, Jamf ID is receiving improvements and security enhancements. New user sign-ups will be disabled during this time. Note: Once this update is complete, all Jamf ID users must reset their passwords. Summary: Jamf ID is undergoing security enhancements, causing new user sign-ups to be disabled temporarily. All existing users will need to reset their passwords after the update.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 1, 20:00 UTC  -  Mar 2, 20:00 UTC

Mar 1, 12:58 UTC
Scheduled - On March 1-2, Jamf ID is receiving improvements and security enhancements. New user sign-ups will be disabled during this time; however, existing users can continue to log-in.

Note: Once this update is complete, all Jamf ID users must reset their passwords.

item.title: Jamf ID Upgrade
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Jamf ID System Improvements and Security Enhancements

On March 1-2, Jamf ID will be undergoing improvements and security enhancements. New user sign-ups will be disabled during this time, but existing users can continue to log in. After the update is complete, all Jamf ID users must reset their passwords.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 1, 08:00 UTC  -  Mar 2, 08:00 UTC

Feb 27, 15:23 UTC
Scheduled - On March 1-2, Jamf ID is receiving improvements and security enhancements. New user sign-ups will be disabled during this time; however, existing users can continue to log-in.

Note: Once this update is complete, all Jamf ID users must reset their passwords.

item.title: Jamf Pro Partial Outage
item.content:encoded:
Feb 12, 22:29 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 12, 15:32 UTC
Monitoring - We have finished the investigation and the remediation of the issue. At this time we will continue to monitor the situation, thank you for everyone's patience and we apologize for any disruptions this might have caused.

Feb 12, 13:47 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 12, 02:14 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue that is affecting some Jamf Pro Premium Cloud customers hosted in the us-east-1 region. We will provide an update ASAP.

Feb 12, 00:46 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 11, 22:50 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 11, 22:50 UTC
Investigating - An issue has been identified that is affecting some Jamf Pro Premium Cloud customers hosted in the us-east-1 region. We are working to resolve and will provide next update in 45 minutes.

item.title: Upgrades are not currently possible.

Feb 9, 11:21 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 9, 11:21 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 9, 11:20 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 9, 11:19 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 9, 09:17 UTC
Investigating - Due to an ongoing issue upgrading is not currently available for standard customers.

item.title: Jamf Pro Partial Outage
item.content:encoded:
Feb 8, 18:32 UTC
Resolved - The small population of instances, as well as their respective load balancers, in London and Sydney should be back up and running fine at this time. Sorry for any inconveniences this has caused with the disruption to your production day.

Feb 8, 17:34 UTC
Identified - At this time we have identified the issue. We have taken steps to resolve and we have just a few instances left in a degraded state. These instances being down were caused by some changes to load balancers affecting a small number, (roughly 5%) in each region.

Feb 8, 15:22 UTC
Investigating - An issue has been identified that is affecting some Jamf Pro customers in the London region and Sydney region. We are working to resolve and will provide next update in 45 minutes.

item.title: Degradation: Jamf Pro Cloud
item.content:encoded:
Feb 6, 22:45 UTC
Resolved - The incident affecting our cloud servers has been successfully resolved. We have conducted a thorough review of our systems and will be conducting an internal investigation of the incident. We understand the importance of our cloud services to your business operations, and we apologize again for any inconvenience this incident may have caused.

Feb 5, 06:42 UTC
Monitoring - We have completed applying the fix in the ap-northeast-1 and us-west-2 regions. We are continuing to monitor for additional issues. Thank you for your patience.

Feb 5, 02:33 UTC
Update - We have completed applying the fix in the ap-southeast-2 region. We are continuing to resolve issues in us-west-2, ap-northeast-1. Thank you for your patience.

Feb 4, 22:44 UTC
Update - We have found a small amount of customers that are affected in the ap-southeast-2 region that we are working on getting resolved. Thank you for your patience.

Feb 3, 17:36 UTC
Update - We have completed ap-southeast-2, eu-central-1, eu-west-2, us-east-1 regions. We are continuing to resolve issues in us-west-2, ap-northeast-1. Thank you for your patience.

Feb 2, 22:38 UTC
Update - We recognize the significant impact this outage may have on your operations and sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please be assured that our team is fully committed and working tirelessly to resolve this issue promptly. We anticipate the current disruptions may continue well into the weekend, but we are making every effort to restore services to full capacity as quickly as possible. Your understanding and patience are greatly appreciated during this time.

Feb 2, 18:31 UTC
Update - We understand the critical role our cloud services play in your operations and sincerely apologize for the current inconvenience. Please be assured that we are fully committed to swiftly resolving this issue by deploying all necessary resources. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

Feb 2, 07:35 UTC
Update - While we continue to work to resolve this issue, we also have identified a small number of instances that may be temporarily unavailable in the regions marked as "partial outage"

Feb 1, 22:46 UTC
Update - Our team is actively working to resolve the issue and restore normal service as quickly as possible. We have completed ap-northeast-1, we will update this thread as regions complete. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Feb 1, 21:01 UTC
Update - Our team is actively working to resolve the issue and restore normal service as quickly as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Feb 1, 16:41 UTC
Update - We have a team dedicated to finding the root source of the issue. We are close to identifying the source and will implement a fix as soon as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience this caused over the last few days.

Feb 1, 11:39 UTC
Update - We continue to work towards a resolution of this issue.

Jan 31, 12:17 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a resolution for this issue.

Jan 31, 02:33 UTC
Identified - An issue has been identified affecting Jamf Pro Cloud:
- instance creations, updates, and deletes may fail
- some instances may see SSL errors

Engineers have identified the issue and are working to resolve it as soon as possible

item.title: Jamf Pro Partial Outage
item.content:encoded:
Dec 5, 08:44 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 5, 04:24 UTC
Update - While our team has completed the work to relieve the intermittent instability with some Jamf Pro services, we are continuing to monitor the situation and will issue updates as further information is available.

Dec 5, 01:06 UTC
Update - Our team is continuing to work to resolve the issues for the remaining customers. Please note, some may still experience intermittent instability with Jamf Pro services.

We appreciate your patience as we finalize these fixes.

Dec 4, 19:19 UTC
Update - A large group of instances are back and operational at this time only a subset of customers remain in a degraded state.

Dec 4, 18:13 UTC
Update - We have identified a solution and are implementing this fix in a rolling fashion. In the meantime, if you are logged in you may be logged out of your Jamf Pro instance. This is currently isolated to a subset of our total hosting environment.

Dec 4, 08:55 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor and remediate impact to customers.

Dec 4, 03:40 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Dec 4, 03:13 UTC
Update - At this point the fix seems to be working, we will continue to monitor the restarts.

We have begun to see some reports of Jamf Premium Cloud Customers in multiple regions that may be affected. These customers are being handles on a case by case basis.

Our top priority is to ensure the stability and reliability of our services, and we are taking every precaution to address any unforeseen challenges that have arisen during the outage.

Dec 3, 22:24 UTC
Update - At this point the fix seems to be working, we will continue to monitor the restarts. Our top priority is to ensure the stability and reliability of our services, and we are taking every precaution to address any unforeseen challenges that have arisen during the outage.

Dec 3, 20:43 UTC
Monitoring - At this we have implemented a fix, we will need to run a rolling restarts on all impacted regions for this to take effect. Regions impacted APNE1, EUC1, USE1, USW2. Those restarts are already kicked off and we anticipate this to be very low impact and completed over the next few hours.

Dec 3, 18:54 UTC
Update - We are continuing our efforts with all parties involved, and this continues to impact our servers. We recognize the impact of this extended downtime may have on your business, and we sincerely apologize for any disruption this may be causing.

Dec 3, 17:38 UTC
Update - We have narrowed down the issue to a 3rd party, and we are actively in communication with them and our teams. We will provide updates hourly as we progress to resolve the issue.

Dec 3, 08:54 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Dec 3, 08:47 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Dec 3, 08:00 UTC
Investigating - An issue has been identified that is affecting some Jamf Pro customers.

item.title: Jamf Protect degraded performance in us-east-1
item.content:encoded:
Nov 29, 16:06 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 29, 16:05 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Nov 28, 21:55 UTC
Investigating - A service provider outage in us-east-1 is affecting Jamf Protect service in this region. Customers may see delays in updated computer and alert information in the console.
